alert.note: Alert for Minnehaha (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 7:53AM MDT until April 11 at 1:00PM MDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in South Dakota... Split Rock Creek near Corson affecting Minnehaha County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...South Dakota... Flandreau Creek near Flandreau affecting Pipestone and Moody Counties. Sixmile Creek near Brookings affecting Brookings County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Split Rock Creek near Corson. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the parking lot at the racetrack may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM CDT Sunday was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 9.3 feet this afternoon. It will then rise to 9.7 feet this evening. It will fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 4.8 feet early Thursday morning. It will then rise to 5.0 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Split Rock Creek Corson 8.5 9.4 Sun 7 am 9.1 6.8 5.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1100 AM CDT.
